str2: From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Singular

str2: Feminine of a derivative of soter as noun; rescue or safety.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From prophetes; to foretell events, divine, speak under inspiration, exercise the prophetic office.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To seek out, seek out after, require. From ek and zeteo; to search out, i.e.investigate, crave, demand, worship.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To search diligently, I examine carefully (minutely). From ek and ereunao; to explore.
